description: Leaf samples used for measuring specific leaf area and leaf water content.

elements.description: The site in which the leaf sample was collected. Used as a filter to only show bulk leaf samples collected in the selected site.
elements.label: Filter: Site

elements.description: The bulk leaf sample from which the fresh leaf sample is collected.
elements.label: Sample

elements.description: NE PAS SUPPRIMER CE CHAMP. Certaines données utilisent peut être cette valeur (10 juil 2018)
elements.label: Sample

elements.description: Comments or notes about the bulk leaf sample from which the leaf area and water sample is taken.
elements.label: Sample Remarks

elements.description: A list of names of people responsible for weighing the rehydrated leaf sample. The primary collector should be listed first.
elements.label: Weighed By

elements.description: The date when the rehydrated leaf sample was weighed.
elements.label: Date Weighed

elements.description: Comments or notes about the dried leaf sample.
elements.label: Dried Leaf Sample Remarks

elements.description: Ratio of total leaf area to dry mass.
elements.label: Specific Leaf Area (m2 / kg)

elements.description: Ratio of leaf dry mass to area.
elements.label: Leaf Mass Per Area (g / m2)

elements.description: Leaf dry-matter content (LDMC) is the oven-dry mass (mg) of a leaf, divided by its water-saturated fresh mass (g), expressed in mg / g.
elements.label: Leaf Dry Matter Content (mg / g)

elements.description: Complement of Leaf Dry Matter Content (= 1000 - LDMC). Ratio of water relative to total leaf mass in turgid state.
elements.label: Leaf Water Content (mg / g)

elements.description: Actual water content of a given amount of leaf relative to the amount of water it contains in its fully hydrated state.
elements.label: Leaf Relative Water Content (%)

elements.description: Mass of water per unit leaf area (g / cm2 = cm because 1 g water = 1 cm3)
elements.label: Equivalent Water Thickness (cm)

elements.description: Unique field ID for the plastic bag used to hold the fresh leaves during rehydration. Defined automatically as the Unix timestamp (= number fo seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00UTC) - 1519142458 (to obtain a smaller number).
elements.label: Bag ID

elements.description: A barcode or QR code that identifies the plastic bag.
elements.label: Bag Barcode

elements.description: Comments or notes about the small sample used for specific leaf area and leaf water measurements.
elements.label: SLA/Water Sample Remarks

elements.description: Total fresh mass (g) of leaves used for SLA / water measurements, after leaves are fully rehydrated. Does not include the petiole, but includes the midrib vein (or rachis for compound leaves).
elements.label: Total Rehydrated Leaf Mass (g)

elements.description: A list of names of people responsible for weighing the rehydrated leaf sample. The primary collector should be listed first.
elements.label: Weighed By

elements.description: The date when the rehydrated leaf sample was weighed.
elements.label: Date Weighed

elements.description: Comments or notes about the rehydrated leaf sample.
elements.label: Rehydrated Leaf Sample Remarks

elements.description: The parent folder in which the  current working folder is stored. Named as the project name and the sub directory leafscans. Use a shared folder (e.g. Google Drive).
elements.label: Parent Directory

elements.description: The name of folder where scan files are saved.
elements.label: Working Folder

elements.description: Name of leaf scan image file. Use the bag ID.
elements.label: File Name

elements.description: Area of all scanned leaves (cm2) in the selected image, after leaves are fully rehydrated. Does not include the petiole, but includes the midrib vein (or rachis for compound leaves).
elements.label: Rehydrated Leaf Area (cm2)

elements.description: Comments or notes about the leaf scan.
elements.label: Scan Remarks

elements.description: Total area of all scanned leaves (cm2) across all files, after leaves are fully rehydrated. Does not include the petiole, but includes the midrib vein (or rachis for compound leaves).
elements.label: Total Rehydrated Leaf Area (cm2)

elements.description: The date when the rehydrated leaf sample was scanned.
elements.label: Date Scanned

elements.description: Unique field ID for the plastic bag used to hold the fresh leaves during rehydration. Defined automatically as the Unix timestamp (= number fo seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00UTC) - 1519142458 (to obtain a smaller number).
elements.label: Bag ID

elements.description: A barcode or QR code that identifies the plastic bag.
elements.label: Bag Barcode

elements.description: Total mass (g) of fresh leaves selected for SLA/water measurements, directly after being harvested (keep in sealed plastic bag or vial until measurement to avoid too much water loss; breathe into bag to close stomata), before leaf is fully rehydrated. Does not include the petiole, but includes the midrib vein (or rachis for compound leaves).
elements.label: Total Leaf Fresh Mass (g)

elements.description:
Number of individual leaves (not leaflets) weighed.

If less than one leaf, estimate the fraction of a leaf that is measured.
elements.label: Number of Leaves

elements.description: A list of names of people responsible for weighing the fresh leaf sample. The primary collector, especially one who applies a personal identifier (Bag ID or Barcode), should be listed first.
elements.label: Weighed By

elements.description: The date when the fresh leaf sample was weighed.
elements.label: Date Weighed

elements.description: Comments or notes about the fresh leaf sample.
elements.label: Fresh Leaf Sample Remarks

name: Leaf Area and Water Samples

status_field.description: Status of record. Record first requires verification. Once verified, it can be submitted for approval; this locks the record for standard users. If approved, the record eventually gets published. If rejected, it goes back to standard users for further verification.
status_field.label: Record Status
